intro: Limonium bahamense var. bahamense, commonly known as the Bahamian sea lavender, is a flowering plant native to the Bahamas and parts of the Caribbean. It belongs to the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Limonium bahamense var. bahamense is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to withstand salty and windy conditions.
